topic: How to combine calendar with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to combine calendar with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)

response_parsed.title: Combining Calendar and Typing for Production Code in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer demonstrates the usage of the Calendar and Typing modules in Python 3.12+ to create robust, efficient, and type-safe production code.
key_points: Understanding the Calendar module for date manipulation
Leveraging Type Hints with the new Typing module
Best practices for structuring and organizing your code

code_examples.code:
from datetime import datetime
from typing import Dict, List,
Calendar, NOT_A_DAY

def get_next_monday(dt: datetime) -> datetime:
    cal = Calendar.instance()
    weekday = cal.monthdayscalendar[dt.year][dt.month - 1].weekday()
    if weekday != 0: # Sunday is the first day of the week in Python
        days_to_next_monday = (7 - weekday) % 7
        dt += timedelta(days=days_to_next_monday)
    return dt

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for the usage of the new Typing module
Upcoming Python versions may bring additional functionality to the Calendar module
caveats: Always ensure proper input validation and edge cases handling in your code
Consider using external libraries such as Arrow for more advanced date manipulation if necessary
